dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kicking off with some weather news, uh, for our listeners in Almaty. Looks like they're in for some pretty significant rain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kicking off with some weather news, uh, for our listeners in Almaty. Looks like they're in for some pretty significant rain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Heavy rain is expected in Almaty over the next 24 hours, citing the city's akimat (local government administration).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? I saw a headline earlier, something about heavy downpours?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? I saw a headline earlier, something about heavy downpours?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right. The city's akimat, their local government, is saying to expect heavy rain over the next 24 hours. Like, starting today, June 20th, from 3 PM all the way to 2 AM tomorrow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right. The city's akimat, their local government, is saying to expect heavy rain over the next twenty four hours. Like, starting today, June twentieth, from three P M all the way to two A M tomorrow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Kazhydromet, from 3:00 p.m. on June 20 to 2:00 a.m. on June 21, the city will see rain, occasionally heavy...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wow, that's a long stretch. And how much are we talking about? Is it just a light drizzle or...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a long stretch. And how much are we talking about? Is it just a light drizzle or...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, definitely not a drizzle. Kazhydromet is predicting up to 20 millimeters of precipitation. Plus thunderstorms, and even a possibility of hail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, definitely not a drizzle. Kazhydromet is predicting up to twenty millimeters of precipitation. Plus thunderstorms, and even a possibility of hail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the city will see rain, occasionally heavy, with up to 20 mm of precipitation, along with thunderstorms and the possibility of hail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty millimeters! That's, um, that's a lot, right? For such a short period?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty millimeters! That's, um, that's a lot, right? For such a short period?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. They're saying it could be over a third of their *entire* monthly rainfall for June, all in just a few hours. The average for June is 59 mm, so that's pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. They're saying it could be over a third of their entire monthly rainfall for June, all in just a few hours. The average for June is fifty nine millimeters, so that's pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forecasters are predicting over a third of the city™s monthly rainfall in just a few hours (the June average is 59 mm).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. Okay, so that's pretty serious. What about the winds, then, with that kind of storm coming in?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. Okay, so that's pretty serious. What about the winds, then, with that kind of storm coming in?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question. Winds are expected to shift from southeast to northwest, with gusts potentially up to 15 to 20 meters per second. So, pretty blustery too. Temperatures will be around 28 to 30 Celsius during the day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question. Winds are expected to shift from southeast to northwest, with gusts potentially up to fifteen to twenty meters per second. So, pretty blustery too. Temperatures will be around twenty eight to thirty Celsius during the day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wind speeds are expected to shift from southeast to northwest, reaching 3"8 m/s with gusts up to 15"20 m/s. Daytime temperatures will range from +28 to +30ÂC, the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, heavy rain, thunderstorms, hail, strong winds... Sounds like a proper storm. Are they, um, doing anything to prepare for potential flooding, like?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, heavy rain, thunderstorms, hail, strong winds... Sounds like a proper storm. Are they, um, doing anything to prepare for potential flooding, like?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. They've actually deployed 52 rapid response mobile teams already. They've got motor pumps and emergency tools ready to go.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. They've actually deployed fifty two rapid response mobile teams already. They've got motor pumps and emergency tools ready to go.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To prevent potential flooding, 52 rapid response mobile teams have been deployed, equipped with motor pumps and emergency tools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's smart. I guess they're trying to prevent a repeat of any past issues. I mean, how many people are we talking about here?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's smart. I guess they're trying to prevent a repeat of any past issues. I mean, how many people are we talking about here?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the numbers are pretty impressive. They've got 426 units of specialized equipment, 26 motor pumps, and almost 900 road workers active across the city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the numbers are pretty impressive. They've got four hundred twenty six units of specialized equipment, twenty six motor pumps, and almost nine hundred road workers active across the city.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently, 426 units of specialized equipment, 26 motor pumps, and 895 road workers are active across the city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] So, like, a full-scale operation then. And what about the public? Any warnings for residents?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, a full-scale operation then. And what about the public? Any warnings for residents?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. The Almaty Department for Municipal Infrastructure Development is urging people not to litter in irrigation ditches, storm drains, or any water channels.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. The Almaty Department for Municipal Infrastructure Development is urging people not to litter in irrigation ditches, storm drains, or any water channels.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Almaty Department for Municipal Infrastructure Development urges the public to: Residents are also reminded not to litter in irrigation ditches (aryks), storm drains, or water channels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because that'll just clog everything up and make the flooding worse. And I bet there are, like, fines for that, aren't there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because that'll just clog everything up and make the flooding worse. And I bet there are, like, fines for that, aren't there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yup, exactly. Violators will face administrative fines under Article 505. They're serious about keeping those drains clear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yup, exactly. Violators will face administrative fines under Article five hundred five. They're serious about keeping those drains clear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Violators will be subject to administrative fines under Article 505 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of Kazakhstan...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Good. And didn't they just have some bad weather, too? I vaguely remember hearing about a hurricane-force wind recently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good. And didn't they just have some bad weather, too? I vaguely remember hearing about a hurricane-force wind recently.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You're right. Just yesterday, on June 19th, a sudden hurricane-force wind swept through. It caused noticeable damage, according to the akimat. So, they're probably extra cautious given that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're right. Just yesterday, on June nineteenth, a sudden hurricane-force wind swept through. It caused noticeable damage, according to the akimat. So, they're probably extra cautious given that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, on June 19, a sudden hurricane-force wind swept through Almaty. The brief storm left noticeable damage, according to the city akimat.
